page.title: 01GOWY VALLEY GENERAL REVIEW
page.content: Between Cheshire's dominant sandstone ridge and the ancient county town of Chester lies the Gowy Valley. The River Gowy meanders through pleasant water-meadows, many now drained,which are a haven for many birds, some migrant. The three settlements of Great Barrow, Guilden Sutton & Littleton flank the valley. It is predominantely a farming area, which these villages serve.They have been expanded and most people now commute to work. This reflects in the home life & life-style of many of the inhabitants.Because the setting is rural,ecology and conservation are of interest to many. The communities are very active reflected in clubs and recreation. There is no industry but trade is represented.
